definition: A supernatural being of Germanic mythology, typically depicted as a small, elusive figure.
examples: Álfr býr í skóginum. (The elf lives in the forest.)
Sögur um álfar eru algengar í norrænum þjóðsögum. (Stories about elves are common in Norse folklore.)

definition: A circular band worn as an ornament or a symbol of authority or membership.
examples: Hann bar gullinn baug á fingri. (He wore a golden ring on his finger.)
Baugr var notaður sem gjaldmiðill. (The ring was used as a currency.)

definition: A weapon with a long metal blade and a hilt, used for thrusting or striking.
examples: Brandr var hengdur við vegginn. (The sword was hung on the wall.)
Hann brá brandi í bardaga. (He drew his sword in battle.)

definition: An undead creature in Norse mythology, often associated with burial mounds.
examples: Draugr vaknar í haugnum. (The ghost awakens in the mound.)
Fólk trúði á drauga í fornöld. (People believed in ghosts in ancient times.)

definition: A member of a mythical race of short, stout beings who are skilled in mining and metalworking.
examples: Dvergr bjó undir fjalli. (The dwarf lived under the mountain.)
Dvergar voru kunnir smiðir. (Dwarves were known as skilled craftsmen.)

definition: A bird of prey with keen eyesight, a hooked beak, and powerful talons.
examples: Haukr situr á greininni. (The hawk sits on the branch.)
Haukar eru þekktir fyrir veiðiskap sinn. (Hawks are known for their hunting skills.)

definition: A large, hoofed mammal of the family Equidae, domesticated since ancient times.
examples: Hestrinn hleypur um haga. (The horse runs around the pasture.)
Hestar voru mikilvægir í norrænum samfélögum. (Horses were important in Norse societies.)

definition: A protective head covering, typically made of metal or leather.
examples: Hann setti hjálm á höfuð sitt. (He put a helmet on his head.)
Hjálmr var oft prýddur með málverkum. (The helmet was often adorned with paintings.)

definition: A large, black bird known for its intelligence and distinctive call.
examples: Hrafn flýgur yfir vígvöllinn. (The raven flies over the battlefield.)
Hrafnar eru tákn Óðins. (Ravens are a symbol of Odin.)

definition: A male ruler of a kingdom; a monarch.
examples: Konungr ríkir yfir landinu. (The king rules over the land.)
Konungr Haraldur var frægur. (King Harald was famous.)

definition: A nobleman ranking below a king but above a thane or a chieftain.
examples: Jarl stjórnaði stóru héraði. (The earl ruled a large district.)
Jarl var ráðgjafi konungsins. (The earl was the king's advisor.)

definition: A large snake, especially a mythical one.
examples: Ormr kræktist í holtinu. (The serpent coiled in the mound.)
Ormrinn Jörmungandr er frægur í goðafræðinni. (The serpent Jörmungandr is famous in mythology.)

definition: A carnivorous mammal of the dog family, known for its pack behavior and howling.
examples: Úlfr hylur í skóginum. (The wolf howls in the forest.)
Úlfar eru oft í norrænum sögum. (Wolves are often in Norse stories.)

definition: A seafaring warrior and explorer from the late 8th to early 11th centuries.
examples: Víkingr fór á langferðir. (The Viking went on long voyages.)
Víkingar voru þekktir sem miklir sjómenn. (Vikings were known as great seamen.)

definition: A small watercraft used for transportation or leisure.
examples: Bátr lá við bryggjuna. (The boat lay at the pier.)
Þeir sigldu á báti yfir vatnið. (They sailed in a boat across the water.)

definition: A long pole weapon with a sharp pointed head, used for thrusting or throwing.
examples: Geirr flaug yfir völlinn. (The spear flew over the field.)
Hann bar geir í höndum sér. (He carried a spear in his hands.)

definition: An adult human male.
examples: Maðr gekk eftir vegnum. (A man walked down the road.)
Þar var gamall maðr sem sagði sögur. (There was an old man who told stories.)

definition: A person who steals or commits theft.
examples: Þjófr var gripinn með eigur annars manns. (The thief was caught with another man's possessions.)

definition: A series of thoughts, images, or emotions that occur during sleep.
examples: Hann hafði undarlegan draum. (He had a strange dream.)

definition: A limbless cold-blooded vertebrate animal with gills and fins.
examples: Fiskr syndir í ánni. (The fish swims in the river.)

definition: Any nutritious substance that is eaten, drunk, or otherwise taken into the body to sustain life.
examples: Matr var borinn fram á borðið. (Food was served on the table.)
Þeir safna mat fyrir veturinn. (They gather food for the winter.)

definition: The opening through which food passes into the body and vocal sounds are emitted.
examples: Orð flugu úr munni hans. (Words flew out of his mouth.)
Hann lokaði munni sínum þegar hann borðaði. (He closed his mouth when he ate.)

definition: A food made from the pressed curds of milk, often seasoned and aged.
examples: Ostr var skorinn í bita. (The cheese was cut into pieces.)
Þeir borðuðu ostr með brauði. (They ate cheese with bread.)

definition: A dish consisting of oatmeal or another cereal boiled in water or milk.
examples: Grautr var hafður til morgunverðar. (Porridge was had for breakfast.)
Hann eldaði graut til kvöldverðar. (He cooked porridge for dinner.)

definition: A covering for the head, especially one with a shaped crown and brim.
examples: Hann setti hatt á höfuðið. (He put a hat on his head.)
Hattr var notaður til að verja sig frá sólinni. (The hat was used for protection from the sun.)

definition: A tool or weapon with a metal blade and a handle, used for cutting or stabbing.
examples: Knífr var notaður til að skera matinn. (The knife was used to cut the food.)
Hann hvessir kníf sinn. (He sharpens his knife.)

definition: A process of combustion characterized by heat and light, especially a flame.
examples: Eldr brann í arninum. (Fire burned in the hearth.)
Þeir kyntu eld til að halda sér hlýjum. (They lit a fire to keep themselves warm.)

definition: A cascade of water falling from a height, formed when a river or stream flows over a precipice or steep incline.
examples: Forsinn fellur af háum kletti. (The waterfall falls from a high cliff.)
Þeir fundu stóran fors í skóginum. (They found a large waterfall in the forest.)

definition: A large fenced or walled area; a city or a structure serving as an enclosure.
examples: Garðr var byggður til að verja borgina. (A fence was built to protect the city.)
Hann býr í gamla garðinum. (He lives in the old city.)

definition: An artificial hill or elevation of earth, especially over a grave.
examples: Haugr var reistur til minningar um konunginn. (A mound was raised in memory of the king.)
Gömul goðsagnir segja frá haugum með fjársjóðum. (Old legends tell of mounds with treasures.)

definition: The earth or universe as a physical realm, or a region or realm within it.
examples: Níu heimar eru í norrænni goðafræði. (Nine worlds are in Norse mythology.)
Heimrinn er fullur af undrum. (The world is full of wonders.)

definition: A small island or a piece of land surrounded by water.
examples: Hólmr var í miðju vatninu. (An islet was in the middle of the lake.)
Þeir settust á hólm nærri ströndinni. (They settled on an islet near the coast.)

definition: A large area covered chiefly with trees and undergrowth.
examples: Skógrinn var þéttur og gróinn. (The forest was dense and overgrown.)
Þeir fóru í veiðiferð í skóginum. (They went on a hunting trip in the forest.)

definition: An open field or a grassy land, especially one used for hay or pasture.
examples: Vangrinn var blómstrandi um sumarið. (The meadow was blooming in the summer.)
Þeir hvíldu í vanginum. (They rested in the meadow.)

definition: A carnivorous mammal of the dog family, often used in mythology and symbolism.
examples: Vargrinn veiddi í skóginum. (The wolf hunted in the forest.)
Sögur af vargum eru algengar í gömlum þjóðsögum. (Stories of wolves are common in old folk tales.)

definition: A broad inlet of the sea where the land curves inward.
examples: Þeir sigldu inn í váginn. (They sailed into the bay.)
Vágrinn var friðsæll og fallegur. (The bay was peaceful and beautiful.)

definition: A route or way for traveling from one place to another.
examples: Vegrinn leiðir til borgarinnar. (The road leads to the city.)
Þeir gengu á vegnum um skóginn. (They walked on the path through the forest.)

definition: A hole or excavation in the ground from which water springs.
examples: Ég fylli búnaðinn við vatn úr brunninum. (I fill the equipment with water from the well.)
Vatn úr brunninum var tært og ferskt. (The water from the well was clear and fresh.)

definition: The sharp or pointed end of something.
examples: Ólafur vissi ekki hvort hann myndi lifa til annars oddar dagsins. (Ólafur did not know if he would live until the end of the day.)
Oddr spjótsins var bitur. (The tip of the spear was sharp.)

definition: A loose granular substance, typically found on beaches and in deserts.
examples: Ströndin er með gylltan sand. (The beach has golden sand.)
Börnin leika sér í sandinum. (The children play in the sand.)

definition: The perceptible natural movement of the air.
examples: Vindrinn blæs sterkt í dag. (The wind is blowing strongly today.)
Vindurinn leikur í trjánum. (The wind plays in the trees.)

definition: Referring to a person who has authority, control, or power over others.
examples: Dróttinn ræðr öllu. (The Lord rules all.)
Dróttinn borgarinnar var réttlátur maður. (The lord of the city was a just man.)

definition: Referring to a person who behaves dishonestly or unethically.
examples: Níðingr stal fénu. (The scoundrel stole the money.)
Hann var kallaður níðingr fyrir svik sín. (He was called a villain for his treachery.)

definition: Referring to a person who is the legal property of another and is forced to obey them.
examples: Þræll vinnur á akri. (The slave works in the field.)
Þrælar voru algengir í norrænum samfélögum. (Slaves were common in Norse societies.)

definition: A member of the principal pantheon in Norse religion; a deity.
examples: Áss er dýrkaður. (The god is worshiped.)

definition: A tool with a heavy metal head used for breaking things or driving in nails.
examples: Hamarr er í húsi. (The hammer is in the house.)

definition: The expanse of air over the Earth; the celestial abode of divine beings.
examples: Himinn er blár. (The sky is blue.)

definition: A naturally raised area of land, smaller than a mountain.
examples: Hóll er grænn. (The hill is green.)

definition: Frozen water, a brittle, transparent crystalline solid.
examples: Íss er kaldur. (The ice is cold.)

definition: A mythological being in Norse mythology, often opposed to the gods.
examples: Jötunn er stór. (The giant is big.)

definition: A violent disturbance of the atmosphere with strong winds and usually rain, thunder, or snow.
examples: Stormr er ógnandi. (The storm is threatening.)

definition: A vehicle used for transporting goods or people, usually pulled by horses.
examples: Vagn er fullur af heyi. (The wagon is full of hay.)
Þeir drógu vagninn yfir sléttuna. (They pulled the wagon over the plain.)

definition: The hard fibrous material that forms the main substance of the trunk or branches of a tree; a large solid piece of wood.
examples: Viðr er í eldi. (The wood is in the fire.)
Þeir sögðu viði til að smíða hús. (They sawed wood to build a house.)

definition: The particular condition that someone or something is in at a specific time; the development of events beyond a person's control.
examples: Dómr hans er óljós. (His fate is uncertain.)
Dómr bæjarins var ákveðinn í bardaga. (The state of the town was decided in battle.)

definition: A person who buys and sells goods, especially on a large scale.
examples: Kaupmaðr selur vörur. (The merchant sells goods.)
Kaupmaðrinn kom með skipi sínu. (The merchant came with his ship.)

definition: A unit of currency; a piece of metal used as a medium of exchange.
examples: Hann hefur margar penningar. (He has many coins.)
Penningr var fundinn á götunni. (A coin was found on the street.)

definition: A male child or young man.
examples: Sveinn er glaður. (The boy is happy.)
Sveinn leikur sér úti. (The boy plays outside.)

definition: The state of being a slave; a condition of hard work and subjection.
examples: Þrældómr er óréttlátur. (Slavery is unjust.)
Hann bjó undir þrældómi allt sitt líf. (He lived under servitude all his life.)

definition: A type of tree known for its hard wood, often used to make weapons; a spear made from the wood of an ash tree.
examples: Askr vex í garðinum. (The ash tree grows in the garden.)
Þeir smíðuðu spjót úr aski. (They crafted spears from ash wood.)

definition: A strong, fast, or high-spirited horse; a steed used in battle or for travel.
examples: Drasill er fljótr. (The steed is fast.)

definition: The ability to do something or act in a particular way; physical or mental strength.
examples: Hans máttr er ótrúlegur. (His power is incredible.)

definition: Compassion or forgiveness shown toward someone whom it is within one's power to punish or harm.
examples: Hann bað um grið. (He asked for mercy.)

definition: A large expanse of salt water, typically one of the world's main divisions.
examples: Haf er dýpt og óendanlegt. (The sea is deep and endless.)

definition: The action of buying something; an agreement between parties.
examples: Hann gerði gott kaup. (He made a good deal.)

definition: A nation or territory; the solid part of the earth's surface.
examples: Land mitt er fallegt. (My country is beautiful.)

definition: The direction in which a compass needle normally points, toward the horizon on the left side when one is facing east.
examples: Vindurinn blæs frá norðri. (The wind blows from the north.)

definition: Guidance or recommendations offered concerning prudent action; a conclusion or resolution.
examples: Hann gaf mér gott ráð. (He gave me good advice.)

definition: A particular position or point in space; a residence or home.
examples: Þetta er fallegur staðr. (This is a beautiful place.)

definition: The act of buying slaves or people for servitude.
examples: Hann gerði þrælakaup í borginni. (He made a slave purchase in the city.)

definition: A small farm or rural property; a courtyard associated with a dwelling.
examples: Þeir bjuggu á litlum boe. (They lived on a small farmstead.)

definition: A warm-blooded egg-laying vertebrate distinguished by feathers and flight.
examples: Fugl flýgur yfir vatnið. (A bird flies over the water.)

definition: The primary city or town of a country or region, typically its seat of government and administrative center.
examples: Höfuðstaðrinn var miðpunktur ríkisins. (The capital was the center of the kingdom.)

definition: A male offspring of parents.
examples: Sonr hans var duglegur maður. (His son was a diligent man.)

definition: People considered as a group, or a body of troops.
examples: Fólk safnaðist saman á torginu. (People gathered together in the square.)

definition: Vegetation consisting of typically short plants with long, narrow leaves.
examples: Gras vex á vellinum. (Grass grows in the field.)

definition: A structure serving as a dwelling for one or more persons.
examples: Hús þeirra var við sjávarsíðuna. (Their house was by the seaside.)

definition: A large boat used for navigating in deep water, especially at sea.
examples: Skip sigldi til fjarlægra landa. (The ship sailed to distant lands.)

definition: The warmest season of the year, typically marked by long days and short nights.
examples: Sumar er tími sólar og hlýju. (Summer is the time of sun and warmth.)

definition: A colorless, transparent, odorless liquid; a large body of water surrounded by land.
examples: Þeir drekka vatn úr lindinni. (They drink water from the spring.)

definition: The direction or point on the horizon where the sun sets at the equinoxes, opposite to the east.
examples: Þeir fóru til vestrs. (They went to the west.)

definition: A female offspring of parents.
examples: Dóttir hans er mjög klár. (His daughter is very clever.)
Hún er dóttir konungsins. (She is the king's daughter.)

definition: An adult female person; a spouse.
examples: Kona hans er læknir. (His wife is a doctor.)
Konur söfnuðust í kirkjunni. (Women gathered in the church.)

definition: An alcoholic beverage made from fermented grapes or other fruits.
examples: Þeir drukku veig á veislu. (They drank wine at the feast.)
Veigar voru dýrar á þeim tímum. (Strong drinks were expensive in those times.)

definition: A small bay or inlet along the coast; a recess in the shore.
examples: Skip lenti í víkinni. (The ship landed in the cove.)
Vík var full af fiskibátum. (The bay was full of fishing boats.)

definition: A long seat for several people, typically made of wood or stone.
examples: Þeir sátu á bekki í húsinu. (They sat on a bench in the house.)

definition: The necessary items for a particular purpose, especially for activities or tasks.
examples: Búnaðr þeirra var tilbúinn fyrir ferðina. (Their equipment was ready for the journey.)

definition: A liquid that can be swallowed as refreshment or nourishment.
examples: Drykkr var borinn fram á veislunni. (Drinks were served at the feast.)

definition: A person who is invited to visit someone's home or attend an event.
examples: Gestr kom til húss þeirra. (A guest came to their house.)

definition: A military leader or a nobleman in Viking society.
examples: Hersir stjórnaði liðinu. (The chieftain commanded the troop.)

definition: The movable articles in a room or an establishment that make it fit for living or working.
examples: Húsbúnaðr var úr tré og vel smíðaður. (The furniture was made of wood and well crafted.)

definition: A long fireplace or fire pit used for heating and cooking in traditional Norse buildings.
examples: Langeldr var miðpunktur hússins. (The hearth was the centerpiece of the house.)

definition: An alcoholic beverage created by fermenting honey with water.
examples: Mjöðr var vinsæll drykkur meðal víkinga. (Mead was a popular drink among the Vikings.)

definition: A large room, especially in a palace or castle, for receiving and entertaining guests.
examples: Konungurinn tók gesti í stórum sal. (The king received guests in a large hall.)

definition: A broad piece of defensive armor carried on the arm; something that provides protection.
examples: Skjöldr hans var sterkur og traustur. (His shield was strong and reliable.)

definition: A piece of furniture with a flat top and one or more legs; a flat surface on a ship's side.
examples: Þau borðuðu saman við borðið. (They ate together at the table.)

definition: A staple food made from flour and water and usually baked.
examples: Brauð var bakað í hverju húsi. (Bread was baked in every house.)

definition: The lower surface of a room, on which one may walk.
examples: Gólf var þakið með skinni. (The floor was covered with skins.)

definition: A set of words set to music or meant to be sung; a piece of poetry.
examples: Skáld kvað kvæði við hirðina. (The poet recited a poem at the court.)

definition: A poet in ancient Scandinavia, especially one writing in the Old Norse language.
examples: Skáld orti lof um konunginn. (The skald composed praise for the king.)

definition: A weapon with a pointed head, typically of iron or steel, and a long shaft, used for thrusting or throwing.
examples: Spjót var notað í orrustu. (The spear was used in battle.)

definition: A weapon with a long metal blade and a hilt with a handguard, used for thrusting or striking.
examples: Sverð var veglegt vopn víkinga. (The sword was a distinguished weapon of the Vikings.)
Hann bar sverð við hlið sér. (He carried a sword at his side.)

definition: An instrument of combat used to attack or defend in fighting or war.
examples: Vápn voru mikilvæg í víkingatímabilinu. (Weapons were important in the Viking era.)
Þeir báru ýmis konar vápn. (They carried various kinds of weapons.)

definition: Something given voluntarily to another person without expecting anything in return; a present.
examples: Gjöf var gefin í tilefni afmælisins. (A gift was given for the birthday occasion.)
Konungurinn veitti honum dýrmæta gjöf. (The king granted him a precious gift.)

definition: A stately residence or a large and imposing building used for public or ceremonial occasions.
examples: Höll konungsins var ríkulega skreytt. (The king's palace was richly decorated.)
Mikil veisla var í höllinni. (A great feast was in the hall.)

definition: A state of tranquility or quiet; freedom from civil disturbance or hostilities.
examples: Friðr var á landinu undir stjórn konungsins. (There was peace in the land under the king's rule.)

definition: A person engaged or experienced in warfare; a member of an army.
examples: Hermaðr barst hetjulega. (The warrior fought valiantly.)

definition: A state of armed conflict between different nations or states or different groups within a nation or state.
examples: Ófriðr stóð lengi milli tveggja ætta. (The war lasted long between two families.)

definition: A person who is actively opposed or hostile to someone or something.
examples: Óvinr var sigraður í orrustunni. (The enemy was defeated in the battle.)

definition: A person with whom one has a bond of mutual affection, typically one exclusive of sexual or family relations.
examples: Vinr hans stóð með honum í öllu. (His friend stood by him in everything.)

definition: A precious yellow metallic element, highly valued for its beauty and used as a standard of monetary exchange.
examples: Gull glitrar í kistunni. (The gold glitters in the chest.)

definition: The season of the year between summer and winter, during which vegetation matures and fruits ripen.
examples: Haust er tími uppskeru. (Autumn is the time of harvest.)

definition: A building or complex of buildings comprising the domestic quarters and workplaces of monks or nuns.
examples: Klaustr var byggt í dalnum. (A monastery was built in the valley.)

definition: A country, state, or territory ruled by a king or queen.
examples: Ríki hans var mikið og öflugt. (His kingdom was great and powerful.)

definition: A precious grayish-white metal, used for ornaments, coins, and utensils.
examples: Silfr var notað til að prýða gripi. (Silver was used to decorate objects.)

definition: The direction toward the point of the horizon 90° clockwise from east, or the point on the horizon itself.
examples: Þeir héldu í átt til suðrs. (They headed towards the south.)

definition: The season of the year between winter and summer, during which vegetation begins to appear.
examples: Í vár blómstra blóm. (In the spring, flowers bloom.)

definition: A large and significant town or a fortified place.
examples: Borgin stóð á háum klifri. (The city stood on a high cliff.)
Þeir sóttu borgina til að verjast óvinum. (They sought the fortress to defend against enemies.)

definition: The act of traveling from one place to another.
examples: Þeir héldu af stað í langa ferð. (They set off on a long journey.)
Ferðin var full af ævintýrum. (The trip was full of adventures.)

definition: Valuable items, especially of gold, silver, or jewels, that are collected or stored; a precious or valuable object.
examples: Gørsemi var falin í gamalli kistu. (The treasure was hidden in an old chest.)

definition: An area covered with dense trees and underbrush; a wild and uninhabited area.
examples: Þau gengu um mörkina í leit að fæðu. (They walked through the forest in search of food.)

definition: A large group of people united by common descent, history, culture, or language, inhabiting a particular country or territory.
examples: Þjóðin samþykkti nýja lög. (The nation approved new laws.)

definition: An area of open land, especially one planted with crops or pasture.
examples: Þeir yrkja korn á akrinum. (They cultivate grain in the field.)

definition: A period of 24 hours as a unit of time, reckoned from one midnight to the next.
examples: Dagr var bjartur og sólríkur. (The day was bright and sunny.)

definition: An instance of visiting a place or person; the action of moving along or proceeding in a particular direction.
examples: Gangr þeirra til borgarinnar var án atviks. (Their visit to the city was uneventful.)

definition: A slow-moving mass or river of ice formed by the accumulation and compaction of snow on mountains or near the poles.
examples: Jökullinn var stórbrotinn og fallegur. (The glacier was majestic and beautiful.)

definition: Each of the twelve named periods into which a year is divided.
examples: Mánaðrinn var kaldur og rigningarfullur. (The month was cold and rainy.)

definition: Atmospheric water vapor frozen into ice crystals and falling in light white flakes.
examples: Snær fellur þétt á veturna. (Snow falls thickly in the winter.)

definition: A small piece of rock of a size that can be conveniently picked up in one hand.
examples: Steinn var notaður í smíði og byggingar. (Stone was used in construction and buildings.)

definition: A day during the summer season, characterized by long daylight hours and typically warmer weather.
examples: Sumardagr var heitur og sólríkur. (The summer day was hot and sunny.)

definition: The coldest season of the year, in the northern hemisphere from December to February and in the southern hemisphere from June to August.
examples: Vetr var harður með mikilli snjókomu. (The winter was harsh with heavy snowfall.)

definition: A large natural stream of water flowing in a channel to the sea, a lake, or another river.
examples: Áin rennur í gegnum dalinn. (The river runs through the valley.)

definition: A community of people living in a particular area; a district or region.
examples: Byggðin lá við sjávarsíðuna. (The settlement lay by the seaside.)

definition: A tract of open uncultivated land, especially one covered with heather.
examples: Heiðr var þakin lyngi og mosa. (The moor was covered with heather and moss.)

definition: A wild or uninhabited area, often characterized by ruggedness and lack of human habitation.
examples: Óbyggðin var viðamikil og ógastleg. (The wilderness was vast and formidable.)

definition: The star at the center of the solar system, around which the Earth and other planets revolve.
examples: Sólin skín björt á himninum. (The sun shines bright in the sky.)

definition: A narrative or story, especially one recounting historical or mythological events.
examples: Sögnin segir af hetjum og goðum. (The tale tells of heroes and gods.)

definition: A being or entity, often supernatural in nature, such as a spirit or demon.
examples: Vættir bjuggu í skóginum. (Creatures lived in the forest.)

definition: A large natural elevation of the earth's surface rising abruptly from the surrounding level.
examples: Fjall rís hár yfir dalinn. (The mountain rises high above the valley.)

definition: A superhuman being or spirit worshiped as having power over nature or human fortunes.
examples: Goðin voru dýrkuð af víkingum. (The gods were worshiped by the Vikings.)

definition: A land or region situated in the north, often referring to Scandinavian countries.
examples: Norðrland var þekkt fyrir harða vetr. (The northern country was known for its harsh winters.)

definition: The act of giving one thing and receiving another in return; interaction or activities involving other people.
examples: Skipti þeirra voru góð. (Their dealings were good.)

definition: An enclosed piece of ground, typically around a farmhouse or manor.
examples: Tún var gróðursælt og fallegt. (The enclosed field was fertile and beautiful.)

definition: The state of the atmosphere at a place and time, including wind, temperature, cloudiness, moisture, and pressure.
examples: Veðr var skiftandi þennan dag. (The weather was changing that day.)

definition: An uninhabited and desolate region, often characterized by harsh conditions and sparse vegetation.
examples: Öræfin voru víðfeðm og óbyggð. (The wilderness was vast and uninhabited.)

definition: A place where someone lives; a dwelling or home.
examples: Bólstaðurinn hans var í litlu þorpi. (His residence was in a small village.)

definition: A young man or a warrior, often connoting bravery and honor.
examples: Drengrinn var hetja í orrustunni. (The boy was a hero in the battle.)

definition: A long, narrow, deep inlet of the sea between high cliffs, typically formed by submergence of a glaciated valley.
examples: Fjörðurinn var umkringdur háum fjöllum. (The fjord was surrounded by high mountains.)

definition: A person legally entitled to the property or rank of another on that person's death.
examples: Leifr tók við búi eftir föður sinn. (The heir took over the estate after his father.)

definition: Substance that soils or defiles; mud or fecal matter.
examples: Saurr var á fötum hans eftir vinnuna. (There was dirt on his clothes after work.)

definition: A person who is eminent or outstanding in a particular sphere or profession.
examples: Skörungrinn var virtur meðal manna. (The distinguished person was respected among people.)

definition: A hard, pointed, often curved part that grows from the top of the head of some animals, or an angular or pointed projection.
examples: Búrinu var útbúið með hornum. (The bull was equipped with horns.)
Hann stóð í horni herbergisins. (He stood in the corner of the room.)

definition: A word or set of words by which a person, animal, place, or thing is known, addressed, or referred to.
examples: Nafn hans var mikið þekkt. (His name was well known.)

definition: An assembly or council, especially in the context of a governance or decision-making body.
examples: Menn komu saman á þingi til að ræða málin. (People came together at the assembly to discuss matters.)

definition: A female being, often referring to a goddess or a supernatural woman in Norse mythology.
examples: Dísir voru álitnar verndarar. (The goddesses were considered protectors.)

definition: A conflict or struggle between armies, groups, or individuals.
examples: Hildr var hörð og blóðug. (The battle was fierce and bloody.)

definition: The side of a hill or mountain; a piece of ground lying at a particular angle.
examples: Hús þeirra var á hlíðinni. (Their house was on the hillside.)

definition: A route or direction followed to reach a destination; a track or course.
examples: Leiðin var löng og torfær. (The way was long and difficult.)

definition: A low area of land between hills or mountains, typically with a river or stream flowing through it.
examples: Dalurinn var gróinn með blómum. (The valley was filled with flowers.)

definition: A covering for the head and neck, typically part of a coat or cloak; a covering worn on the face to conceal one's identity.
examples: Grímrinn var hluti af búningi hans. (The hood was part of his outfit.)

definition: The state of being holy or sacred; divine quality.
examples: Helgi staðarins var viðurkennd af öllum. (The sanctity of the place was recognized by all.)

definition: A small, sheltered valley or recess in a hillside.
examples: Hvammurinn var fagur og friðsæll. (The hollow was beautiful and peaceful.)

definition: A type of large fish known for its pink flesh, or specifically a male of the species.
examples: Hoengurinn var veiddur í ánni. (The salmon was caught in the river.)

definition: A vessel for boiling liquids or cooking food, typically made of metal and with a lid.
examples: Ketillinn brann á eldinum. (The kettle boiled on the fire.)

definition: A person who settles in a new colony or moves into new country.
examples: Landnámsmenn komu frá Noregi. (The settlers came from Norway.)

definition: A natural spring of water that is heated geothermally; a place for bathing.
examples: Laugar voru vinsælar meðal víkinga. (The hot springs were popular among the Vikings.)

definition: The end part of a person's arm beyond the wrist, including the palm, fingers, and thumb.
examples: Mundr hans var sterk og þétt. (His hand was strong and firm.)

definition: The part of a river where it meets the sea; the mouth of a river.
examples: Óssinn var fullur af fiski. (The estuary was full of fish.)

definition: A person exercising government or dominion.
examples: Valdrinn réði ríkinu með réttlæti. (The ruler governed the kingdom with justice.)

definition: An open area of land, especially one planted with crops or pasture, typically bounded by hedges or fences.
examples: Völlurinn var þakinn með grasi. (The field was covered with grass.)

definition: A place where someone lives and works, especially a farm or homestead.
examples: Búið var stórt með mörgum dýrum. (The farm was large with many animals.)

definition: A large natural flow of water moving along a definite path, usually into a sea, lake, or another river.
examples: Fljótið rennur gegnum dalinn. (The river flows through the valley.)

definition: A building dedicated to the worship of deities in Norse paganism.
examples: Hofið var helgað goðunum. (The temple was dedicated to the gods.)

definition: A piece of land projecting into a body of water, typically a sea or lake, forming a headland or peninsula.
examples: Nesið var þekkt fyrir sínar fallegar ströndur. (The peninsula was known for its beautiful beaches.)

definition: The material forming the outer surface of an animal's body, or a piece of this material.
examples: Skinnið var notað til að búa til föt. (The hide was used to make clothes.)

definition: Land owned collectively or in common by members of a community or society.
examples: Almenningur var notaður fyrir beit. (The common land was used for grazing.)

definition: A predetermined course of events considered as something beyond human power or control.
examples: Auður hans var óræður. (His fate was uncertain.)

definition: A written or printed work consisting of pages glued or sewn together along one side; a piece of fabric with woven designs.
examples: Bókin fjallaði um sögu víkinga. (The book was about the history of the Vikings.)

definition: A piece of land surrounded by water.
examples: Eyin var lítil en falleg. (The island was small but beautiful.)

definition: Wet, muddy ground too soft to support a heavy body; a swamp.
examples: Mýrin var þekkt fyrir sínar villtjur. (The marsh was known for its wild animals.)

definition: The land along the edge of a sea, lake, or other large body of water.
examples: Ströndin var þakið með hvítum sandi. (The shore was covered with white sand.)

definition: A rural community or region; a small settlement or village.
examples: Sveitin var friðsæl og falleg. (The village was peaceful and beautiful.)

definition: A young human being below the age of puberty or below the legal age of majority.
examples: Barnið lék sér fyrir utan húsið. (The child played outside the house.)

definition: The act of causing the death of a person, especially unlawfully.
examples: Drápið var rannsakað af lögreglunni. (The murder was investigated by the police.)

definition: The act of falling or collapsing; a decline or failure.
examples: Fall trésins var heyrt í skóginum. (The fall of the tree was heard in the forest.)

definition: Molten rock expelled by a volcano during an eruption; a field covered by lava.
examples: Hraunið var enn heitt og ósnertanlegt. (The lava was still hot and untouchable.)

definition: A shallow body of water separated from a larger body of water by barrier islands or reefs.
examples: Lónið var vinsælt ferðamannastaður. (The lagoon was a popular tourist destination.)

definition: A female bear.
examples: Bera var að leita matar fyrir unga sína. (The she-bear was searching for food for her cubs.)

definition: The act of giving assistance or aid; support given to someone in a difficult situation.
examples: Björgin kom rétt tímanlega. (The help arrived just in time.)

definition: A long, involved story, account, or series of incidents, often historical or legendary in nature.
examples: Saga var sögð við eldstæðið. (A saga was told by the hearth.)

definition: A long body of water curling into an arched form and breaking on the shore.
examples: Unnirnar voru háar á sjónum. (The waves were high on the sea.)

definition: A member of the Varangians, Norsemen who served as mercenaries in Byzantium and other parts of Eastern Europe.
examples: Væringinn fór til Miklagarðs til að þjóna keisaranum. (The Varangian went to Constantinople to serve the emperor.)

definition: A body of soldiers, warriors, or any organized group of people.
examples: Liðið var tilbúið til orrustu. (The troop was ready for battle.)

definition: A piece of writing, especially a book or other formal written work.
examples: Ritið var mikilvæg heimild um sögu tímabilsins. (The writing was an important source on the history of the period.)

definition: The end of life; the cessation of all biological functions that sustain a living organism.
examples: Bani kom bráðlega eftir veikindin. (Death came swiftly after the illness.)
Bani Óðins var stór atburður í goðsögunum. (The demise of Odin was a significant event in the myths.)

definition: A sustained fight between large organized armed forces.
examples: Bardagi stóð lengi og var harður. (The battle lasted long and was fierce.)
Í bardaga falla margir menn. (Many men fall in a fight.)

definition: The action or fact of dying or being killed; the end of the life of a person or organism.
examples: Dauði er óhjákvæmilegur hluti lífsins. (Death is an inevitable part of life.)
Dauði konungsins markaði tímamót. (The death of the king marked an era.)

definition: A man unduly concerned with looking stylish and fashionable.
examples: Flosi var þekktur fyrir skart sitt. (The dandy was known for his adornment.)
Flosi gengur í nýjustu tísku. (The fop walks in the latest fashion.)

definition: The action of fleeing or running away.
examples: Flótti var eina kosturinn þeirra. (Flight was their only option.)
Í flótti leita menn skjóls. (In escape, people seek shelter.)

definition: Clothing made from the fur of animals.
examples: Heðinn var mikilvægur í köldum vetrum. (Fur garment was important in cold winters.)
Heðinn var gerður úr úlfskinnum. (The fur clothing was made from wolf skins.)

definition: A person who resides in a house; typically a worker or a member of a household.
examples: Heimamaðr sá um dagleg verk á býlinu. (The householder took care of daily chores on the farm.)
Heimamaðrinn vann lengi úti í garði. (The worker toiled long in the garden.)

definition: A small hill or mound.
examples: Hváll var lítið en gróinn þúfum. (The hillock was small but covered with tufts.)
Þeir settust niður á hválinum til að hvíla. (They sat down on the knoll to rest.)

definition: The negative impact or injury caused to something.
examples: Skaði var mikill eftir storminn. (The damage was great after the storm.)
Þeir bættu fyrir skaðann sem þeir ollu. (They compensated for the harm they caused.)

definition: A building or room providing living quarters.
examples: Skáli var miðpunktur heimilisins. (The hall was the focal point of the home.)
Í skálanum héldu þeir veislur. (In the dwelling, they held feasts.)

definition: A large open-air fire used for burning waste or as part of a celebration.
examples: Bál var kveikt til að fagna sumarsólstöðum. (A bonfire was lit to celebrate the summer solstice.)
Á bálinu brunnu þeir gömlu trén. (On the pyre, they burned the old woods.)

definition: A space just below the roof of a house, often used for storing things.
examples: Loftið var notað til að geyma gömul húsgögn. (The loft was used to store old furniture.)
Í loftinu heyrist stundum furðuleg hljóð. (Strange noises are sometimes heard in the attic.)

definition: A stack of hay, typically arranged in a field.
examples: Arfasátan var há og vel byggð. (The haystack was tall and well-built.)
Þau leituðu skjóls við arfasátuna. (They sought shelter by the haystack.)

definition: A hinged, sliding, or revolving barrier at the entrance to a building, room, or vehicle, or in the framework of a cupboard.
examples: Dyrrnar opnuðust hægt. (The doors opened slowly.)
Við dyrrnar stóðu tveir varðmenn. (Two guards stood at the doorways.)

definition: An act of traveling from one place to another.
examples: För þeirra var löng og ströng. (Their journey was long and arduous.)
Í ferðalaginu upplifðu þau ýmis ævintýri. (On the trip, they experienced various adventures.)

definition: The act of traveling or moving on foot.
examples: Ganga um skóginn var róandi. (Walking through the forest was calming.)
Þau fóru í göngu um fjöllin. (They went for a stroll in the mountains.)

definition: The act of making something holy or sacred.
examples: Helga hússins fór fram með athöfn. (The consecration of the house was performed with a ceremony.)
Helga þessarar stundar var mikilvæg fyrir þá. (The sanctification of this moment was important for them.)

definition: The quality of having a courageous spirit and physical power.
examples: Hreysti hennar var þekkt víða. (Her bravery was known far and wide.)
Hreysti í orrustu var lofað. (Strength in battle was praised.)

definition: A piece of furniture for sleep or rest, typically a framework with a mattress.
examples: Hvílan var gerð úr tré og mjúkum fjöðrum. (The bed was made of wood and soft feathers.)
Á hvílunni lá gamall maður. (On the resting place lay an old man.)

definition: A stack or pile of hay stored in a field.
examples: Sátan var full af þurrkuðu heyi. (The haystack was full of dried hay.)
Bændur bjuggu til sátur á sumrin. (Farmers made ricks in the summer.)

definition: A way out of a building, room, or passenger vehicle; the end or conclusion of an event or process.
examples: Útganga var við enda gangarins. (The exit was at the end of the hallway.)
Útganga sögunnar var óvænt. (The end of the story was unexpected.)

definition: A person engaged in combat or warfare.
examples: Bardagamaðrinn var reyndur í orrustu. (The fighter was experienced in battle.)
Hver bardagamaðr hafði sitt sverð. (Every warrior had his sword.)

definition: A person who is notably successful or fortunate.
examples: Gæfumaðrinn fann fjársjóðinn. (The lucky person found the treasure.)
Hann var þekktur sem gæfumaðr í viðskiptum. (He was known as a fortunate one in business.)

englishTranslation: valley dweller, person from the valley
definition: A person living in or originating from a valley.
examples: Doellinn bjó í langri og grónri dal. (The valley dweller lived in a long and verdant valley.)
Doelirnir voru þekktir fyrir landbúnað sinn. (The people from the valley were known for their agriculture.)

definition: The final part of something; a part or fragment of something larger.
examples: Endi sögunnar var óvæntur. (The end of the story was unexpected.)
Hann skar enda af brauðinu. (He cut a piece off the bread.)

definition: A person noted for courageous acts or nobility of character.
examples: Kappi sýndi hugrekki í orrustu. (The warrior showed bravery in battle.)
Saga fjallar um kappann og ævintýri hans. (The saga tells of the hero and his adventures.)

definition: A person exhibiting excessive pride or self-importance.
examples: Ofstopamaðrinn neitaði að hlusta á aðra. (The arrogant person refused to listen to others.)
Ofstopamaður í hópnum skapaði spennu. (An arrogant man in the group created tension.)

definition: A term used by Norse explorers to refer to the indigenous peoples of Greenland and North America.
examples: Skrælingjar bjuggu á landinu þegar víkingarnir komu. (The skraelings lived on the land when the Vikings arrived.)
Skrælingi sýndi þeim hvernig á að veiða. (The skraeling showed them how to hunt.)

definition: A woman who is often involved in arguments and who asserts her authority over others.
examples: Svarri var þekkt fyrir sitt skap. (The quarrelsome woman was known for her temper.)
Hann kvæntist svarra sem stjórnaði heimilinu. (He married a quarrelsome and authoritative woman who ruled the household.)

definition: A heated or angry disagreement; an argument.
examples: Deila þeirra varð hávær. (Their dispute became loud.)
Deilur risu um arfleifðina. (Quarrels arose over the inheritance.)

definition: A type of Norse skaldic poetry consisting of a series of stanzas, typically in praise of a notable person.
examples: Drápa var saminn til heiðurs konungi. (The drápa was composed in honor of the king.)
Í drápunni eru lýst hetjudáðir hans. (In the drápa, his heroic deeds are described.)

definition: The quality of being pleasing to the senses or to the mind.
examples: Fegrð hennar var þekkt um allt land. (Her beauty was known throughout the land.)
Fegrð náttúrunnar var óviðjafnanleg. (The beauty of nature was incomparable.)

definition: An adult female human being.
examples: Gerðr í þorpinu voru þekktar fyrir handverk sitt. (The women in the village were known for their handicraft.)
Gerðr hennar var af mikilli ætt. (Her womanhood was of great lineage.)

definition: A person who is admired for their courage, outstanding achievements, or noble qualities.
examples: Hetja sögunnar bjargaði bænum. (The heroine of the story saved the town.)
Hetjur þessarar sögu eru dáðlausar. (The heroes of this tale are fearless.)

definition: A long, narrative poem, typically detailing heroic deeds and events that are significant to a culture or nation.
examples: Kviða um Þorstein var full af ævintýrum. (The epic poem about Thorstein was full of adventures.)
Í kviðunni eru lýst fornar hetjur. (In the epic, ancient heroes are described.)

definition: The action of saving or being saved from sin, error, or evil; the action of setting someone free from imprisonment, slavery, or oppression.
examples: Lausn fangans var keypt fyrir gull. (The prisoner's redemption was bought with gold.)
Lausn þrælsins markaði nýtt upphaf. (The slave's release marked a new beginning.)

definition: A woman in relation to her child or children.
examples: Móðir hans var kona af miklum dyggðum. (His mother was a woman of great virtues.)
Móðir umhyggju sinnar veitti börnunum hlýju. (The mother provided warmth to her children with her care.)

definition: A sustained fight between large, organized armed forces.
examples: Orrusta stóð við Hafrsfjörð. (A battle took place at Hafrsfjord.)
Í orrustunni sýndu þeir mikla hugrekki. (In the fight, they showed great bravery.)

definition: A letter of an ancient Germanic alphabet or something secret or mysterious.
examples: Rún var rist á steininn. (A rune was carved on the stone.)
Rúnar geyma fornar sögur og visku. (Runes hold ancient tales and wisdom.)

definition: The muscular organ in the mouth or the system of spoken or written communication used by a particular country or people.
examples: Tunga hennar var fljót að mæla. (Her tongue was quick to speak.)
Forn tunga var notuð í ritum. (An ancient language was used in writings.)

definition: A group of lines forming a unit in a poem or song; a stanza.
examples: Vísa þessi var sungin við hátíðir. (This verse was sung at festivals.)
Í hverri vísu felst sérstök saga. (Each stanza contains a unique story.)

definition: A verse or stanza of a poem that stands alone or independently.
examples: Lausavísa þessi var vinsæl meðal skálda. (This free verse was popular among poets.)
Lausavísa getur verið hvöss og hnyttin. (An epigram can be sharp and witty.)

definition: A tool used for chopping wood, typically consisting of a steel blade and a handle.
examples: Øx var notuð til að höggva við. (The axe was used for chopping wood.)
Hann bar øx í belti sínu. (He carried a hatchet in his belt.)

definition: A nickname or epithet, often used to denote a fierce or violent individual.
examples: Blóðøx var nafn gefið ógnarstjórnanda. (Bloodaxe was a name given to a formidable ruler.)
Saga Blóðøxar er þekkt í norrænum goðsögum. (The saga of Bloodaxe is known in Norse mythology.)

definition: Third-person singular masculine pronoun
examples: Hann gekk til búðarinnar. (He went to the store.)
Hann sá skipið á fjörðunum. (He saw the ship in the fjords.)

definition: First-person singular pronoun
examples: Ek heiti Ólafur. (I am called Ólafur.)
Ek fara til borgarinnar. (I am going to the city.)

definition: Second-person singular pronoun
examples: Þú ert vinur minn. (You are my friend.)
Þú kemur seinna. (You are coming later.)

russianTranslation: тот, этот / та, эта / то, это
definition: Third-person singular neuter pronoun used to refer to a previously mentioned or easily identifiable object or concept.
examples: Þat er gott skip. (That is a good ship.)
Sá ek þat. (I saw it.)

definition: Used to refer to the entirety of a person, object, group, or concept; complete, not divided.
examples: Allr heimurinn fagnar. (The whole world celebrates.)
Allir menn voru samþykkir. (All men were in agreement.)

definition: Used to describe a large number of people or things.
examples: Margir menn komu til þingsins. (Many men came to the assembly.)
Margr maðr veit ekki hvað hann á. (Many a man does not know what he owns.)

definition: Used to refer to an unspecified amount or number of people or things, or to a particular but unspecified one.
examples: Sumir segja þat satt vera. (Some say that it is true.)
Sumr maðr kom til bæjarins. (A certain man came to the town.)

definition: Referring to two entities together.
examples: Báðir menn ganga til veizlu. (Both men are going to the feast.)

definition: Asking about something or expressing surprise.
examples: Hvat heitir þetta? (What is this called?)
Hvat! (What! How! Surprising!)

definition: Referring to one of two entities.
examples: Annarr maðr gekk heim. (One of the two men went home.)

definition: Referring to none or nobody.
examples: Engi maðr kom. (No man came.)

definition: Referring to that specific entity or another.
examples: Hinn maðr er hér. (That man is here.)

russianTranslation: кто / то / та, каждый / каждое / каждая
definition: Referring to who or each one.
examples: Hverr maðr skal fara? (Who shall go?)

definition: Referring to oneself.
examples: Hann sá sik í spegli. (He saw himself in the mirror.)

definition: Referring to such or of that kind.
examples: Slíkr maðr er góðr. (Such a man is good.)

definition: Referring to the person or thing in question as the same as the one previously mentioned.
examples: Hann sjálfr gerði það. (He himself did it.)

russianTranslation: тот / то / та, этот / это / эта, оно
definition: Used to identify a specific person or thing observed or heard by the speaker.
examples: Sá maðr er góður. (That man is good.)

definition: Belonging to or associated with the speaker.
examples: Þetta er minn bók. (This is my book.)

definition: Belonging to or associated with the speaker and one other person.
examples: Þetta er okkarr hús. (This is our house.)

definition: Belonging to or associated with a previously mentioned person or thing.
examples: Hann fann sinn hatt. (He found his hat.)

definition: Belonging to or associated with the speaker and one or more other people.
examples: Þetta er várr bíll. (This is our car.)

definition: Belonging to or associated with the people that the speaker is addressing.
examples: Þetta er yðvarr peningur. (This is your money.)

definition: Belonging to or associated with the two people that the speaker is addressing.
examples: Þetta er ykkarr borð. (This is your table.)

definition: Belonging to or associated with the person or people that the speaker is addressing.
examples: Þetta er þinn hundur. (This is your dog.)

russianTranslation: кто (из двух), который (из двух), каждый (из двух)
definition: Used to refer to one or the other of two people or things.
examples: Hvárr þeirra er sterkari? (Which of the two is stronger?)

definition: Referring to a single person or thing.
examples: Einn maðr gekk á veginum. (One man walked on the road.)

definition: Referring to two people or things.
examples: Tveir bræður bjuggu þar. (Two brothers lived there.)

definition: Referring to three people or things.
examples: Þrír fuglar sátu á trénu. (Three birds sat on the tree.)

definition: Referring to four people or things.
examples: Fjórir menn komu til búðarinnar. (Four men came to the shop.)

definition: Enough in quantity or degree; plentiful, ample.
examples: Matr var nógr á borðinu. (There was sufficient food on the table.)
Auður hans var nógr. (His wealth was abundant.)

definition: Located at an equal distance from the extremities; centrally positioned.
examples: Miðr vegurinn er breiður. (The middle of the road is wide.)
Hann stóð í miðri stofunni. (He stood in the middle of the room.)

definition: Used to identify a specific person or thing observed or heard by the speaker; the nearer or more immediate of two or more.
examples: Sjá maðr talar satt. (This man speaks the truth.)
Sjá bók er gamall. (That book is old.)

definition: The number equivalent to the sum of two and three; one more than four.
examples: Fimm skip komu til hafnar. (Five ships came to the harbor.)

definition: The number equivalent to the sum of three and three; one more than five.
examples: Sex menn unnu í garðinum. (Six men worked in the garden.)

definition: The number equivalent to the sum of three and four; one more than six.
examples: Sjau nætur í röð. (Seven nights in a row.)

definition: The number equivalent to the sum of four and four; one more than seven.
examples: Átta börn leika sér í túninu. (Eight children are playing in the yard.)

definition: The number equivalent to the sum of four and five; one more than eight.
examples: Níu hestar voru í hlaðinu. (Nine horses were in the barn.)

definition: The number equivalent to the sum of five and five; one more than nine.
examples: Tíu dagar til jólanna. (Ten days until Christmas.)

definition: Negative particle, indicating negation or denial
examples: Hann kemur eigi.
Þau vilja eigi fara.

definition: Adverb indicating location, referring to the current place or position
examples: Hann er hér.
Þau búa hér.

definition: At the present time; at this moment.
examples: Nú er hann hér. (Now he is here.)
Nú skulum við fara. (Now we shall go.)

definition: Expressing a doubt or choice between alternatives.
examples: Hvárt skal ég fara eða vera? (Should I go or stay?)

definition: For what reason or purpose.
examples: Hví grætur þú? (Why are you crying?)

definition: In, at, or to that place or position.
examples: Við skulum fara þar. (We shall go there.)

definition: To a great extent; much.
examples: Hann er mjök fróðr. (He is very learned.)

definition: For that reason; consequently.
examples: Hann var seinn, því hann hljóp. (He was late, therefore he ran.)

definition: In or within a short time; quickly; shortly.
examples: Vetur kemur brátt. (Winter is coming soon.)

definition: Frequently; many times; on many occasions.
examples: Oft hann fer til borgarinnar. (He often goes to the city.)
Oft hafa þeir fundið gull. (They have often found gold.)

definition: To or at the place where one lives.
examples: Hann fer heim. (He goes home.)

definition: To a greater degree; more preferable or suitable.
examples: Hann hjálpar þér gjarna. (He will help you gladly.)
Ég fer gjarna með þér. (I will go with you willingly.)
Hann vill heldr lesa. (He would rather read.)

definition: In addition; besides; up to a particular point, degree, or extent.
examples: Hann er til góður. (He is still good.)

definition: In this manner; in such a way; therefore.
examples: Svá skal það vera. (So it shall be.)
Hann gerði svá sem sagt var. (He did thus as was said.)

definition: In a good or satisfactory manner; with skill or aptitude.
examples: Hann syngur vel. (He sings well.)
Hún samþykkti vel. (She agreed willingly.)

definition: In a direction or manner that returns to a previous position or condition; once more.
examples: Hann fer aftr heim. (He goes back home.)

definition: From a particular place; out of existence or notice.
examples: Hann fer brott. (He goes away.)

definition: In a united or coordinated manner; in conjunction with others.
examples: Þau fara saman. (They go together.)

definition: At that time; at the time in question.
examples: Þá var hann ungur og óreyndur. (He was young and inexperienced then.)

definition: To or in what place or direction.
examples: Hvert ferðu? (Where are you going?)

definition: Over a great distance; from a distant place.
examples: Hann kom langt í burtu. (He came from far away.)

definition: For a considerable duration; for an extended period.
examples: Hann bíðaði lengi. (He waited for a long time.)

definition: Toward or in the northern part or direction.
examples: Hann fer norðr. (He goes northward.)

definition: Toward or in the western part or direction.
examples: Sólin setur vestr. (The sun sets in the west.)

definition: From that place; in the direction away from that location.
examples: Hann kom þaðan. (He came from there.)

definition: Referring to a time subsequent to a previous event; at a later time.
examples: Hann kom fyrst, og síðan komu aðrir. (He came first, and then others came.)
Síðan þetta gerðist, hefur margt breyst. (Since then, much has changed.)

definition: Over or in a wide area; in or to many places.
examples: Fréttirnar dreifðust víða. (The news spread widely.)
Hann hefur ferðast víða. (He has traveled everywhere.)

definition: With a high volume or intensity of sound; at a high decibel level.
examples: Hann talar hátt. (He speaks loudly.)
Þau sungu hátt. (They sang loudly.)

definition: Subsequent to a time or event; later in time or sequence.
examples: Hann kom heim, og eftir það fór hann út aftur. (He came home, and afterwards he went out again.)

definition: Prior to a certain time; earlier or previously.
examples: Áðr sólarupprás, hann var vaknaður. (Before sunrise, he was awake.)
Hann kom áðr en veislan hófst. (He arrived earlier than the feast began.)

definition: In the interior; on the inside.
examples: Þau voru innan hússins. (They were inside the house.)
Innan borgarmúranna, var öruggt. (Within the city walls, it was safe.)

definition: Towards a higher place or position; upwards.
examples: Hann gengur upp fjallið. (He walks up the mountain.)
Ljós loga upp í nóttinni. (Lights flare up in the night.)

definition: Toward or in the southern part or direction.
examples: Þeir sigldu suðr. (They sailed southward.)
Suðr er landið hlýrra. (In the south, the land is warmer.)

definition: Towards or in a place outside, especially away from a building or from the shore into the sea.
examples: Þeir fóru út til að veiða fisk. (They went out to catch fish.)
Hann gekk út úr húsinu. (He walked out of the house.)

definition: To or towards that place or point; there.
examples: Þeir ætluðu að ferðast þangat á sumrin. (They planned to travel there in the summer.)
Hún sendi bréf þangat. (She sent a letter there.)

definition: At an earlier time; in the first place.
examples: Fyrr var alt öðruvísi. (Earlier, everything was different.)
Fyrst þarf að athuga þetta. (Firstly, this needs to be checked.)

definition: To or into the interior or inner part.
examples: Hann gekk inn í húsið. (He went inside the house.)
Ljósið skín inn um gluggann. (The light shines inward through the window.)

definition: Within an enclosed space; in the innermost part.
examples: Þau bjuggu inni í skóginum. (They lived inside the forest.)
Innst í hellinum var myrkur. (In the depths of the cave, it was dark.)

definition: From a higher to a lower position; overhead.
examples: Snefillinn féll ofan frá fjallinu. (The snow fell downwards from the mountain.)
Hann leit ofan á kortið. (He looked above at the map.)

definition: To or at a distance from a particular place or person.
examples: Hann hörfaði undan í skugganum. (He moved away into the shadows.)
Skjóttu undan borðinu. (Push it aside from the table.)

definition: Used to introduce a statement that contrasts with or seems to contradict something that has been said previously.
examples: Þó var veðrið slæmt, fóru þeir út. (However bad the weather was, they went out.)
Hann var ungur, þó var hann vitur. (He was young, yet he was wise.)

definition: Conjunction used to connect words, phrases, clauses, or sentences.
examples: Hann er sterkur ok hugrakkur. (He is strong and brave.)
Þau komu ok sáu. (They came and saw.)

definition: Conjunction used to introduce a contrasting or comparative clause
examples: Hann er kaldur en þú ert heitur.
Þau vilja fara, en ég vil ekki.

definition: Relates to the word 'which' or 'when'
examples: Bókin er góð, er er skrifuð á ensku.
Hann kom í bókasafnið er það var að loka.

definition: Introduces a clause of purpose or a subordinate clause.
examples: Hann sagði at hann væri þreyttur. (He said that he was tired.)
Þeir báðu at hann kæmi. (They asked that he would come.)

definition: Used to introduce a clause expressing the reason or cause.
examples: Því at hann var veikur, fór hann ekki út. (Because he was sick, he did not go out.)
Því at veginn er háll, skal fara varlega. (Because the road is slippery, one should go carefully.)

definition: Used to connect words of the same part of speech, clauses, or sentences that are to be taken jointly.
examples: Hann er bæði góður ok hreinn. (He is both good and pure.)

definition: Used to introduce a further negative statement; not either.
examples: Hann er eigi gamall né ungur. (He is neither old nor young.)

definition: Used to introduce a conditional clause.
examples: Ef þú ferð, verð ég einn. (If you go, I will be alone.)
Ef þú hefur hungur, eta. (If you are hungry, eat.)

definition: During the time that; for the period or duration that.
examples: Syng meðan þú vinnur. (Sing while you work.)
Meðan sólin skín, er gott veður. (As long as the sun shines, the weather is good.)

definition: Introducing a comparison or an example; used to compare or equate two things.
examples: Hann gerir sem hann vill. (He does as he wishes.)
Sem maður sáir, svo sker hann. (As a man sows, so shall he reap.)

definition: Used to introduce a comparison or equivalence.
examples: Svá sem dagur fylgir nóttu. (Just as day follows night.)
Hann talar svá sem hann veit allt. (He talks as if he knows everything.)

definition: Used to link alternatives or indicate a choice.
examples: Viltu kaffi eða te? (Do you want coffee or tea?)

definition: Used to express affirmation or agreement.
examples: Já, ég vil fara í bókasafnið. (Yes, I want to go to the library.)
Hún spurði hvort ég hef lesið þessa bók, og ég sagði já. (She asked if I have read this book, and I said yes.)

definition: Used to express disagreement or refusal.
examples: Nei, ég er ekki viss um það. (No, I am not sure about that.)
Hann spurði hvort ég gæti hjálpað honum, en ég sagði nei. (He asked if I could help him, but I said no.)

definition: An expression of greeting.
examples: Heill! Hvernig hefurðu það? (Hello! How are you?)

definition: Indicating location or position within something; also used to specify a surface.
examples: Bók liggur í hillunni. (The book lies in the shelf.)
Hann situr í stólnum. (He sits on the chair.)

definition: Accompanied by; in the company of.
examples: Hann ferðast með vinum sínum. (He travels with his friends.)
Með sverði í hendi. (With a sword in hand.)

definition: Expressing location or time, often with the sense of being in contact with or attached to something.
examples: Hann sat á stólinum. (He sat on the chair.)

definition: Indicating movement from a place or the point of origin of something.
examples: Hann kom úr húsinu. (He came out of the house.)

definition: In opposition to; as a substitute or equivalent.
examples: Hann er gegn mér. (He is against me.)

definition: Expressing motion in the direction of; indicating the purpose or goal.
examples: Hann fer til bæjar. (He goes to the town.)

definition: Expressing the point in space at which a journey, motion, or action starts; indicating separation or removal.
examples: Hann fer af bænum. (He goes from the town.)

definition: In the vicinity of; close to.
examples: Hann stendur hjá húsi. (He stands by the house.)

definition: Indicating movement in an area; concerning or regarding.
examples: Hann gengur um torgið. (He walks around the square.)

definition: At or to a short distance away from; in the company of; in relation to.
examples: Hann situr við eldinn. (He sits by the fire.)

definition: Extending or directly above; from one side to the other; in or to a position above or higher than.
examples: Hann fer yfir brúna. (He goes over the bridge.)

definition: In the midst of; surrounded by; in the interval or space separating two points.
examples: Hann er meðal vina. (He is among friends.)

definition: In a position below or lower than something else, typically denoting a place or location.
examples: Hann situr undir trénu. (He sits under the tree.)

definition: Used to indicate a point of origin, separation, or distance from something; also used to indicate the subject of something spoken or written.
examples: Hann kom frá fjöllunum. (He came from the mountains.)
Sögur frá fornum tíma. (Stories about ancient times.)

definition: Indicating a location or a particular point in time.
examples: Hann stendur at dyr. (He stands at the door.)
At sumrinu leika börn úti. (During the summer, children play outside.)

definition: Indicating a sequence in time or space; following in time, place, or order.
examples: Eftir borð, þeir fóru að leika. (After the meal, they went to play.)
Ganga eftir vegnum. (Walk along the road.)

definition: Used to indicate the purpose of an action, the time before an event, or the front part of something.
examples: Fyrir kærleika sinn, hann gerði það. (For his love, he did it.)
Standandi fyrir konungi. (Standing before the king.)

definition: Indicating a position or interval separating two points, objects, or entities.
examples: Sáttmáli gerður milli tveggja þjóða. (A treaty made between two nations.)
Milli steins og sleggju. (Between a rock and a hard place.)

englishTranslation: from the east, to the east of
definition: Indicating a direction from the east or a location to the east of something.
examples: Vindurinn kemur austan. (The wind comes from the east.)
Hann býr austan fjallsins. (He lives to the east of the mountain.)

englishTranslation: from the south, to the south of
definition: Indicating a direction from the south or a location to the south of something.
examples: Skipið sigldi sunnan. (The ship sailed from the south.)
Þeir komu sunnan bæjarins. (They came from the south of the town.)

englishTranslation: from the west, to the west of
definition: Indicating a direction from the west or a location to the west of something.
examples: Sólin setur vestan. (The sun sets in the west.)
Borgin liggur vestan árinnar. (The city lies to the west of the river.)

definition: In the company of; accompanied by.
examples: Hann fór á markaðinn ásamt bróður sínum. (He went to the market together with his brother.)
Ásamt vinum sínum byggði hann húsið. (Jointly with his friends, he built the house.)

definition: Inside the limits of; in the duration of.
examples: Innan viku lauk verkefninu. (The task was completed within a week.)
Innan þessara veggja eru leyndarmál. (Within these walls are secrets.)

definition: Used as the third-person singular present indicative form of the verb 'vera' meaning 'to be'.
examples: Hann er góður vinur. (He is a good friend.)
Þau eru góð börn. (They are good children.)

definition: Used as the third-person plural present indicative form of the verb 'eiga' meaning 'to own, to possess'.
examples: Þeir eigu hest. (They own a horse.)
Hún á hús. (She owns a house.)

definition: Used as the third-person singular present indicative form of the verb 'hafa' meaning 'to have'.
examples: Hún hefur bók. (She has a book.)
Þau hafa hund. (They have a dog.)

englishTranslation: to be called, to be named
definition: To have as a name; to be referred to by a specific title or term.
examples: Konungrinn heitir Haraldur. (The king is called Harald.)
Hvað heitir þú? (What are you called?)

definition: To express in words; to convey or communicate verbally.
examples: Hann segir söguna. (He tells the story.)
Segðu mér frá ferðinni þinni. (Tell me about your journey.)

definition: Used as the third-person singular present indicative form of the verb 'sjá' meaning 'to see'.
examples: Hún sér blómin. (She sees the flowers.)
Þau sjá fugl. (They see a bird.)

definition: Used as the third-person singular present indicative form of the verb 'taka' meaning 'to take'.
examples: Hann tekur bók. (He takes a book.)
Hún tekur blómin. (She takes the flowers.)

definition: To strike, to kill, or to attack; typically used in the context of combat or physical confrontation.
examples: Þeir vega óvinina í orrustu. (They attack the enemies in battle.)
Hann vegur dreka með sverði. (He kills the dragon with a sword.)

definition: Used as the third-person singular present tense form of the verb 'vilja' meaning 'to want'.
examples: Hann vill fara í bókasafn. (He wants to go to the library.)
Hún vill borða köku. (She wants to eat cake.)

definition: Infinitive form of the verb 'bíða', meaning 'to wait or to wait for'.
examples: Hann bíður eftir mér. (He is waiting for me.)
Þeir bíða í húsinu. (They wait in the house.)

definition: Infinitive form of the verb 'deyja', meaning 'to die'.
examples: Enginn vill deyja ungur. (No one wants to die young.)
Hann deyr sem hetja. (He dies as a hero.)

definition: Infinitive form of the verb 'flýja', meaning 'to flee or to run away'.
examples: Þau flýja frá eldinum. (They flee from the fire.)
Hann flýr í skóginn. (He flees into the forest.)

definition: Infinitive form of the verb 'hata', meaning 'to hate'.
examples: Hún hatar kalda veðrið. (She hates the cold weather.)
Þeir hata óréttlæti. (They hate injustice.)

definition: Infinitive form of the verb 'hlaupa', meaning 'to run'.
examples: Börnin hlaupa um garðinn. (The children run around the garden.)
Hann hlýpur til hjálpar. (He runs to help.)

definition: This is the infinitive form of 'koma', which means 'to arrive or to appear in a place'.
examples: Hann kemur heim. (He comes home.)
Þeir koma til bæjarins. (They come to the town.)

definition: The infinitive form of 'mæla', which translates to 'to utter words or articulate thoughts'.
examples: Hún mælir mjúklega. (She speaks softly.)
Þau mæla fyrir þingi. (They speak before the assembly.)

definition: Refers to the infinitive form of 'vakna', meaning 'to cease sleeping or to become conscious after sleeping'.
examples: Hann vaknar við sólarupprás. (He wakes up at sunrise.)
Barnið vaknar oft um nóttina. (The child often wakes up during the night.)

definition: This verb means to summon someone or something by calling out loudly or to shout.
examples: Hann kallar á hjálp. (He calls for help.)
Hún kallar nafn hans. (She calls his name.)

definition: Refers to the act of recognizing, identifying, or being familiar with a person or thing.
examples: Þau kenna veginn vel. (They know the way well.)
Hann kennir mér stafina. (He teaches me the letters.)

definition: This verb refers to the action of pursuing or following someone or something swiftly in order to catch them.
examples: Hann eltir hundinn. (He chases the dog.)
Þau elta fuglinn. (They chase the bird.)

definition: It means to consume food; to take food into the body through the mouth.
examples: Hann etur epli. (He eats an apple.)
Þau eta saman. (They eat together.)

definition: This term implies causing fear or alarm; to make someone afraid.
examples: Sagan hræðir börnin. (The story frightens the children.)
Hún hræðir fuglana. (She frightens the birds.)

definition: Refers to the action of making something accessible or visible by uncovering it or removing any barrier.
examples: Hann opnar bókina. (He opens the book.)
Þau opna gluggann. (They open the window.)

definition: Refers to the act of moving or traveling from one place to another.
examples: Hann fer til borgarinnar. (He goes to the city.)
Þau fara heim. (They go home.)

definition: Involves perceiving sound by the ear or paying attention to sounds.
examples: Hún heyrir tónlistina. (She hears the music.)
Þau heyra fuglasöng. (They hear the bird song.)

definition: Means to inquire or seek information by questioning.
examples: Hann spyr um leiðina. (He asks for the way.)
Þau spyrja um verðið. (They ask about the price.)

definition: To respond or reply to a question or statement.
examples: Hún svarar bréfinu. (She answers the letter.)
Þau svara spurningunni. (They answer the question.)

definition: This term refers to the action of pursuing and capturing or killing wild animals.
examples: Hann veiðir fisk. (He catches fish.)
Þau veiða í skóginum. (They hunt in the forest.)

definition: Means to discover or come upon something by searching or by chance.
examples: Hún finnur lykilinn. (She finds the key.)
Þeir finna leiðina. (They find the way.)

definition: To carry or transport someone or something to a place.
examples: Hann færir matinn. (He brings the food.)
Þau færa gjafir. (They bring gifts.)

definition: Involves transferring something to someone, typically voluntarily.
examples: Hún gefur honum bók. (She gives him a book.)
Þeir gefa gjafir. (They give gifts.)

definition: To commit oneself by a promise to do or give; to pledge.
examples: Hann heitir að hjálpa. (He promises to help.)
Þau heita að mæta. (They promise to come.)

definition: To express mirth, joy, or amusement with audible, vocal expulsions of sound.
examples: Hún hlær hátt. (She laughs loudly.)
Þau hlæja saman. (They laugh together.)

definition: To impart knowledge or skill to someone through instruction or example.
examples: Hann kennir þeim stærðfræði. (He teaches them mathematics.)
Hún kennir börnunum að lesa. (She teaches the children to read.)

definition: Refers to the process of combustion, where substances combine chemically with oxygen from the air and typically give out bright light, heat, and smoke.
examples: Skógurinn brennur. (The forest is burning.)
Eldurinn brennur bjart. (The fire burns brightly.)

definition: Means to reside or inhabit a particular place.
examples: Hún býr í húsi. (She lives in a house.)
Þeir búa saman. (They dwell together.)

definition: This meaning of 'búa' refers to preparing or adorning someone or something with necessary apparel or equipment.
examples: Hann býr sig til ferðar. (He equips himself for the journey.)
Hún býr barnið í föt. (She dresses the child.)

definition: Involves the preparation of food by heating or the act of maintaining a fire.
examples: Hann eldar matinn. (He cooks the food.)
Þau elda arininn. (They fuel the hearth.)

definition: Refers to moving downwards, typically rapidly and freely without control, from a higher to a lower level.
examples: Laufið fellur af trénu. (The leaf falls from the tree.)
Hann fellur til jarðar. (He falls to the ground.)

definition: Means to move at a regular pace by lifting and setting down each foot in turn, never having both feet off the ground at once.
examples: Hún gengur um götuna. (She walks down the street.)
Þeir ganga upp fjallið. (They go up the mountain.)

definition: To continue to be alive or to exist; to lead a life of a particular kind.
examples: Hann lifir góðu lífi. (He lives a good life.)
Þau lifa enn. (They are still alive.)

russianTranslation: идти под парусами, плыть на судне
definition: Refers to the act of traveling in a boat with sails, especially as a sport or recreation.
examples: Þeir sigla um hafið. (They sail over the sea.)
Skipið siglir til eyjarinnar. (The ship sails to the island.)

definition: This term is used for extending an offer to someone or giving a command or instruction.
examples: Hann bjóðar henni til dans. (He offers her a dance.)
Hann býður þeim að fara. (He commands them to leave.)

definition: Means to expel air from the lungs through the mouth or to cause air to move around, typically generating a current.
examples: Vindurinn blæs frá norðri. (The wind blows from the north.)
Blása í lúður. (Blow the horn.)

definition: Refers to maintaining an upright position on the feet or continuing to be in a certain state or situation.
examples: Hann stendur við gluggann. (He stands by the window.)
Lögin standa óbreytt. (The laws remain unchanged.)

definition: This term is used when making something visible or clear to someone, typically by presenting it or demonstrating it.
examples: Hún sýnir mér bréfið. (She shows me the letter.)
Sýna listaverk á sýningu. (Display artwork at an exhibition.)

definition: Involves carrying out an action, task, or function.
examples: Hann gørir verkið vel. (He does the work well.)

definition: To show the way to a destination by going in front or beside; to guide.
examples: Hún leiðir barnið í skólann. (She leads the child to school.)

definition: Refers to having a future intention or plan to do something.
examples: Þau munu heimsækja okkur. (They intend to visit us.)

definition: Means to cause to move in a specific direction, especially forcibly.
examples: Hann rek skipið fram. (He drives the ship forward.)

definition: To be under an obligation to do, provide, or pay something; to owe.
examples: Við skulum virða lögin. (We ought to respect the laws.)

definition: Describes the process of change from one state, condition, or phase to another.
examples: Hún verður læknir. (She becomes a doctor.)

definition: To control and steer a vehicle or to travel on a horse or bicycle.
examples: Hann akar vagn. (He drives a wagon.)

definition: To set something on fire or to be consumed by fire.
examples: Við brennum við. (We burn wood.)

definition: To move through the air on wings or to travel in an aircraft.
examples: Fuglinn flýgur. (The bird flies.)

definition: To provide support or assistance to someone.
examples: Hún hjálpar barninu. (She helps the child.)

russianTranslation: сгибать в кольцо, сворачивать в кольца
definition: To wind or twist something into a circular or spiral form.
examples: Hann hringar tauðið. (He coils the rope.)

definition: To move a boat by means of oars or to paddle.
examples: Þau róa bátinn. (They row the boat.)

definition: To keep someone or something safe from harm, danger, or injury.
examples: Hann verndar börnin. (He protects the children.)

definition: Involves the exchange of money for goods, services, or to offset a debt or liability; also implies providing something as compensation.
examples: Hann gjaldar skuld sína. (He pays his debt.)

definition: To keep or maintain something in one's grasp; to continue to possess or contain something.
examples: Hún heldur á blóminu. (She holds the flower.)

englishTranslation: to buy, to make a deal
definition: To acquire something in exchange for money; to agree upon terms in a transaction or agreement.
examples: Þau kaupa hús. (They buy a house.)

definition: To actively look for something; to make an effort or endeavor to do something.
examples: Hann leitar að fölum hesti. (He searches for a lost horse.)

definition: To narrate or relay information; to enumerate or calculate a total.
examples: Hún telur stjörnurnar. (She counts the stars.)

definition: To accept as true or reliable; to place confidence or reliance in someone or something.
examples: Við trúum á guði. (We believe in gods.)

definition: To make a choice from a range of possibilities; to pick out according to preference or judgment.
examples: Þau velja bestu ávextina. (They choose the best fruits.)

definition: To bring about a return to health or normal condition; to remedy a health issue or disease.
examples: Læknirinn læknaði sjúklinginn. (The doctor cured the patient.)

definition: To assign a name to someone or something; to bring up or refer to in speech or writing.
examples: Hún nefnir barnið. (She names the child.)

definition: To get up from a lying, sitting, or kneeling posture; to ascend or increase in height.
examples: Þeir rísa við sólarupprás. (They rise at sunrise.)

definition: To construct or create something by hand or with tools; to fabricate.
examples: Hann smíðar bát. (He crafts a boat.)

englishTranslation: to know, to be oriented (towards something)
