definition: To have information or be informed about something; to have knowledge or awareness.
examples: Þau vita sannleikann. (They know the truth.)

englishTranslation: to lay, to set, to thrust
definition: To put or place something down gently in a flat position; to establish or position something; to thrust or push forcefully.
examples: Hún leggur barnið í vögguna. (She lays the baby in the cradle.)
Þeir leggja steininn á veginn. (They set the stone on the road.)

definition: To express gratitude or show appreciation to someone for their actions, help, or presence.
examples: Við þökkum fyrir veisluna. (We thank for the feast.)
Hún þakkar honum fyrir gjöfina. (She thanks him for the gift.)

definition: To rest or remain in a horizontal position; to be located or placed in a particular setting or context.
examples: Sverðið liggur í kistunni. (The sword lies in the chest.)
Bærinn liggur í dalnum. (The town is situated in the valley.)

definition: To construct or erect a structure; to establish a home or settlement.
examples: Þeir byggja hús. (They build a house.)
Hann byggir í nýju landi. (He settles in a new land.)

definition: To go or come after a person or thing proceeding ahead; to go along with as a companion.
examples: Hundurinn fylgir henni. (The dog follows her.)
Þau fylgja leiðsögumanni. (They accompany the guide.)

definition: To come to shore or reach land; to arrive at a dock or port.
examples: Skipið lendir við bryggjuna. (The ship docks at the pier.)
Þeir lenda á eyjunni. (They land on the island.)

definition: To take liquid into the mouth and swallow; to engage in celebration or festivity.
examples: Þeir drekka mjöð. (They drink mead.)
Hann drekkur til sigurs. (He celebrates the victory.)

definition: To construct or erect a structure with significant height; to build upwards.
examples: Þeir hátimbra turninn. (They build the tower high.)

definition: To utter words or sounds in speech; to vocalize melodically; to recite poems or sing songs.
examples: Hann kveður kvæði. (He recites a poem.)
Hún kveður söng. (She sings a song.)

definition: To fabricate or erect a structure, especially using wood; to assemble building materials to form a structure.
examples: Þeir timbra hús. (They construct a house.)

definition: To cause the death of a living being; to deliberately end the life of someone or something.
examples: Hann banaði óvin sinn. (He killed his enemy.)

definition: To destroy completely; to lay waste or leave in ruins.
examples: Eldurinn eyðir skóginum. (The fire devastates the forest.)

definition: To fill or place a load on something; to arrange objects in a pile or stack.
examples: Þeir hlaða heyið í hlöðu. (They stack the hay in the barn.)

definition: To guide the course of a vehicle or other moving object; to exercise direction over; to control.
examples: Hann stýrir skipinu. (He steers the ship.)

definition: To alter or modify; to separate into parts or distribute among a number of recipients.
examples: Þeir skipta arfinum. (They divide the inheritance.)
Hann skiptir um klæði. (He changes his clothes.)

definition: To place something over or upon, as for protection, concealment, or warmth; to hide from view.
examples: Þau þekja borðið með dúk. (They cover the table with a cloth.)
Hann þekur augun. (He covers his eyes.)

definition: To grasp, acquire, or remove something from a place; to take possession of something.
examples: Hann nemur sverðið. (He takes the sword.)
Þeir nema land. (They seize the land.)

definition: To lift or move to a vertical position; to build or construct, especially a structure.
examples: Þau reisa flaggið. (They raise the flag.)
Hann reisir hús. (He erects a house.)

definition: Beautiful, lovely

definition: Good, kind
examples: Góðr verkr skapar gott karma. (Good work creates good karma.)

definition: Healthy, whole
examples: Heill maðr er heilbrigðr. (A healthy man is whole.)

definition: Bad, evil
examples: Illr hugr leiðir til ills verks. (A bad mind leads to a bad deed.)

definition: Cowardly, timid
examples: Ragr maðr flýr frá bardaga. (A cowardly man flees from battle.)

definition: Angry, furious
examples: Reiðr maðr talar harða. (An angry man speaks harshly.)

definition: Rich, mighty
examples: Ríkr maðr á marga gripi. (A rich man owns many treasures.)

definition: Small, little
examples: Smár fugl syngur í trénu. (A small bird sings in the tree.)

definition: Big, large
examples: Stórr hestur er öflugur. (A big horse is powerful.)

definition: Danish
examples: Danskr maðr talar Dönsku. (A Danish man speaks Danish.)

definition: Happy, joyful
examples: Glaðr maðr hlær. (A happy man laughs.)

definition: Hungry
examples: Svangr úlfur veiðir. (A hungry wolf hunts.)

definition: Black, dark
examples: Svartr hestr hleypur í nótt. (A black horse runs in the night.)

definition: Wide, broad
examples: Breiðr áin er erfitt að yfirfara. (The wide river is difficult to cross.)

definition: Deep
examples: Djúpr sjór hylur leyndardóma. (The deep sea hides mysteries.)

definition: Few, scarce
examples: Fáir menn vita sannleikann. (Few men know the truth.)

russianTranslation: близкий к смерти, обречённый на смерть

definition: In the state of staying in one place or remaining inactive in expectation of something.

definition: Moving at a speed faster than a walk, never having both feet on the ground at the same time.

definition: Causing fear or anxiety by threatening harm or danger.
examples: Hræddr andlit í myrkrinu. (A frightening face in the darkness.)

definition: Crying out to attract attention; shouting.
examples: Kallaðr maðr eftir hjálp. (The man calling for help.)

definition: Aware of or familiar with through experience or information.

definition: Approaching or arriving at a place.
examples: Kominn gestr til húss. (The guest coming to the house.)

definition: Expressing thoughts, feelings, or information verbally.

definition: Uttering or expressing words or phrases.

definition: Ready, eager, or prepared to do something.

definition: Moving or traveling from one place to another.

definition: Presenting voluntarily without expecting compensation.

definition: Making the spontaneous sounds and movements of the face and body that are the instinctive expressions of lively amusement.

definition: Being consumed by fire; aflame.

definition: Residing or existing; inhabiting a place.

definition: Preparing food for eating especially by applying heat; providing fuel or energy.

definition: Moving downward, typically rapidly and freely without control, from a higher to a lower level.

definition: Moving forward on foot at a steady pace; traveling by foot.

definition: Having life; being alive; not dead.

definition: Traveling in a ship or boat using sails, especially as a sport or recreation.

definition: Having been presented for acceptance or rejection; having been commanded or directed.
examples: Boðinn aðstoðar af öryggismönnum, lést hann aldrei. (Offered assistance by security personnel, he never died.)

definition: Currently expelling air or any other substance from the mouth.

definition: Currently being in or maintaining an upright position.

definition: Currently making something visible or evident to the eyes or other senses.

definition: Engaged in performing or executing a particular action.

definition: Guiding or directing in a particular direction; accompanying someone.

definition: Compelling to move in a particular direction; exerting force upon.

definition: To grant mercy or forgiveness; to spare someone from harm or punishment.

definition: To give oneself up, especially to an opposing force or authority; to concede or submit.

definition: To support or aid someone; to remain loyal or steadfast.

definition: In a manner or way that; to the extent or degree that.

definition: Immediately following in time, order, or sequence.

definition: Immediately following in time, order, or sequence.
examples: Hann borðar, því næst sefur. (He eats, then sleeps.)

definition: To accept that someone or something is true, genuine, or trustworthy.
examples: Hann trúar á guð. (He believes in God.)

definition: A mythical tree that plays a central role in Norse cosmology, where it connects the Nine Worlds.
examples: Askr Yggdrasils er miðpunktur heimsins. (The Yggdrasil Ash is the center of the world.)

englishTranslation: set out, embark on a journey
russianTranslation: отправляться в путь, пускаться в путь
definition: To begin a journey or trip; to depart from a place with the intention of traveling.
examples: Hann ætlar að leggja af staði á morgun. (He intends to set out tomorrow.)

definition: Referring to a duration or passage of time measured in months; indicating a time period that spans across several months.
examples: Þeir bjuggu sig undir ferðina svá mánuðum skiptir. (They prepared for the journey over a period of months.)

definition: Used to indicate the time following an event or action; signifies the subsequent period or occurrence.
examples: Eftir at sólin setur, ríkir myrkur. (After the sun sets, darkness prevails.)

definition: Located within the interior or inner part of something.
examples: Hann fann gripi fyrir innan kistu. (He found treasures inside the chest.)

definition: To recite items or names in a sequence; to count off one by one.
examples: Skáldið taldi upp nöfn konunga. (The poet listed the names of the kings.)

definition: To be the first in a race or competition; to arrive or achieve something before others.
examples: Hann varð fyrstr til að finna landið. (He was the first to discover the land.)

definition: Used to indicate the reason or cause for something; as a result of.
examples: Fyrir sakir snjófalls, voru vegir lokaðir. (Because of the snowfall, the roads were closed.)

englishTranslation: as previously mentioned, as said before
definition: Referring back to something that has already been stated or described earlier in the text.
examples: Svá sem áðr segir, hann var mikill höfðingi. (As previously mentioned, he was a great chieftain.)
Eins og svá sem áðr segir, bardaginn var harður. (Just as said before, the battle was fierce.)

englishTranslation: to take a direction, to set off
definition: To begin a journey or to set off in a particular direction.
examples: Þeir ákváðu að leggja leið sína til norðurs. (They decided to set off to the north.)
Hún lagði leið sína heim eftir langan dag. (She took the direction home after a long day.)

definition: The act of running away or escaping from something.
examples: Þeir voru á flótta frá óvinunum. (They were fleeing from the enemies.)
Á flótta fann hún frelsi. (In flight, she found freedom.)

definition: In a higher position than something else; over.
examples: Fyrir ofan bæinn stóð hátt fjall. (Above the farm stood a tall mountain.)
Sólin skín fyrir ofan skýin. (The sun shines over the clouds.)

definition: To the inside or interior of.
examples: Hann gekk inn í skóginn. (He walked into the forest.)
Þau fóru inn í húsið til að hlýja sér. (They went into the house to warm themselves.)

definition: Within a short period of time; soon.
examples: Innan skamms mun vorið koma. (Soon, spring will come.)
Þau lofuðu að snúa aftur innan skamms. (They promised to return shortly.)

definition: To manage to avoid or evade something.
examples: Hann komst undan refsingu. (He escaped punishment.)
Með snilld tókst henni að komast undan. (With skill, she managed to slip away.)

definition: In or to another place.
examples: Þeir leituðu að betra landi annars staðar. (They sought better land elsewhere.)
Hann fann frið annars staðar. (He found peace in another place.)

englishTranslation: to be involved in, to participate in
definition: To be engaged or involved in an activity or affair.
examples: Þeir áttu í orrustu við óvininn. (They were involved in a battle with the enemy.)
Hann átti í viðræðum við kaupmenn. (He participated in negotiations with the merchants.)

definition: To be relevant to; to affect or involve someone or something.
examples: Sagan kom við alla þá sem hlustuðu. (The story touched all those who listened.)
Þessi málefni koma við marga. (These issues pertain to many.)
